What is the purpose of the `getidentitieswithrevocation` command in Verus?

The `getidentitieswithrevocation` command is used to retrieve a list of identities where a specified ID or i-address is the revocation authority. This command allows you to search for identities based on their revocation authority, with optional filters for block heights and active ID UTXOs.

getidentitieswithrevocation '{"identityid":"idori-address", "fromheight":height, "toheight":height, "unspent":false}' Arguments {   "identityid":"idori-address" (string, required) returns all identities where this ID or i-address is the revocation authority   "fromheight":n        (number, optional, default=0) Search for qualified identities modified from this height forward only   "toheight":n         (number, optional, default=0) Search for qualified identities only up until this height (0 == no limit)   "unspent":bool        (bool, optional, default=false) if true, this will only return active ID UTXOs as of the current block height } Result: [                 (array) array of matching identities  {identityobject},        (object) identity with additional member "txout" with txhash and output index  ... ] Examples: > verus getidentitieswithrevocation '{"identityid":"idori-address","fromheight":height,"toheight":height,"unspent":false}' > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getidentitieswithrevocation", "params": ['{"identityid":"idori-address","fromheight":height,"toheight":height,"unspent":false}'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
./raw_text_input_api_text/getidentitieswithrevocation
What are the required and optional arguments for the `getidentitieswithrevocation` command?

The `getidentitieswithrevocation` command requires one argument, `identityid`, which is a string representing the ID or i-address to search for as the revocation authority. The command also has three optional arguments:

* `fromheight`: a number specifying the block height from which to start searching for qualified identities (default is 0).
* `toheight`: a number specifying the block height up to which to search for qualified identities (default is 0, meaning no limit).
* `unspent`: a boolean indicating whether to only return active ID UTXOs as of the current block height (default is false).

getidentitieswithrevocation '{"identityid":"idori-address", "fromheight":height, "toheight":height, "unspent":false}' Arguments {   "identityid":"idori-address" (string, required) returns all identities where this ID or i-address is the revocation authority   "fromheight":n        (number, optional, default=0) Search for qualified identities modified from this height forward only   "toheight":n         (number, optional, default=0) Search for qualified identities only up until this height (0 == no limit)   "unspent":bool        (bool, optional, default=false) if true, this will only return active ID UTXOs as of the current block height } Result: [                 (array) array of matching identities  {identityobject},        (object) identity with additional member "txout" with txhash and output index  ... ] Examples: > verus getidentitieswithrevocation '{"identityid":"idori-address","fromheight":height,"toheight":height,"unspent":false}' > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getidentitieswithrevocation", "params": ['{"identityid":"idori-address","fromheight":height,"toheight":height,"unspent":false}'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/

What is the format of the result returned by the `getidentitieswithrevocation` command?

The `getidentitieswithrevocation` command returns an array of objects, where each object represents a matching identity. Each identity object has an additional member called `txout`, which contains the transaction hash and output index.

getidentitieswithrevocation '{"identityid":"idori-address", "fromheight":height, "toheight":height, "unspent":false}' Arguments {   "identityid":"idori-address" (string, required) returns all identities where this ID or i-address is the revocation authority   "fromheight":n        (number, optional, default=0) Search for qualified identities modified from this height forward only   "toheight":n         (number, optional, default=0) Search for qualified identities only up until this height (0 == no limit)   "unspent":bool        (bool, optional, default=false) if true, this will only return active ID UTXOs as of the current block height } Result: [                 (array) array of matching identities  {identityobject},        (object) identity with additional member "txout" with txhash and output index  ... ] Examples: > verus getidentitieswithrevocation '{"identityid":"idori-address","fromheight":height,"toheight":height,"unspent":false}' > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getidentitieswithrevocation", "params": ['{"identityid":"idori-address","fromheight":height,"toheight":height,"unspent":false}'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/

How can I use the `getidentitieswithrevocation` command in Verus?

You can use the `getidentitieswithrevocation` command in Verus by running it in the command line or by using a curl command with JSON-RPC. Here are two examples:

1. Command line:
```
verus getidentitieswithrevocation '{"identityid":"idori-address","fromheight":height,"toheight":height,"unspent":false}'
```
2. Curl command:
```
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getidentitieswithrevocation", "params": [{"identityid":"idori-address","fromheight":height,"toheight":height,"unspent":false}]} 'H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
